page.title: 18THE BLACK HORSE PUB
page.content: The Black Horse, Thurnham has been a public house for more than 200 years. It is a relatively small pub with a single bar, car park and paddock containing a few tables for summer use. The bar is furnished in a traditional homely style with settees, easy chairs and open fires. At lunch time the pub is mainly used by business men from Maidstone and the surrounding area and retired people from nearby villages. In the summer walkers on the Pilgrims' Way from Winchester to Canterbury often call. There are few people living nearby to use the pub as their local, though there are plenty of regulars of mixed ages in the evenings, the peak season being summer. There are about 1000 customers a week, and 15000 gals of wine,spirits and beer is drunk per yr. Draught beer is 85p. per pint.
